description: Numbers which are sandwiched between two numbers having the same ordered canonical form.
comments: The average of twin primes is a member. Is there ever a prime in the sequence?
example: 34 is sandwiched between 33 and 35 which are of the form p*q where p and q are primes.
mathematica: f[n_] := Flatten[Table[{ # [[2]]}] & /@ FactorInteger[n]]; Drop[ Select[ Range[415], Sort[f[ # - 1]] == Sort[f[ # + 1]] & ], 1]
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 21 2002
extensions: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 22 2002
